Specialties: Stack Testing, Emission Calculations (actual & potential), Life Cycle Assessments, Low Carbon Fuel Standards, Renewal Fuel Standard, Environmental Permitting/Plans/Reporting (Air – Title V/FESOP/PSD/NSR, Air Dispersion Modeling, Water – NPDES/SWPPP/SPCC, EPCRA, RCRA, RMP, GHG MRR) Experience Senior Environmental Engineer Intel Corporation March 2014  – Present (1 year 6 months) Hillsboro, Oregon Senior Environmental Engineer POET Plant Management May 2013  –  March 2014  (11 months) Sioux Falls, South Dakota Area • Establish and maintain an effective environmental compliance management system for 27 operating facilities located in 7 different states. 
 
• Perform Life Cycle Assessments (LCAs) in support of various Low Carbon Fuel Standards (LCFS) and the U.S. Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS) for both starch and cellulosic ethanol production. 
 
• Drive POET’s sustainability efforts (“Ingreenuity”) as part of the leadership team related to goals of water use reduction, increased sustainable production, reduction in GHG intensity, and increase bioproducts production. 
 
• Lead POET’s corporate office’s sustainability efforts, including the implementation of an on-site community garden. 
 
• Represent POET within multiple national trade groups as environmental/sustainability expert to influence/draft comments to federal and state rules and regulations. 
o Co-chair of BIO Climate Change and Sustainability Working Group 
 
• Lead internal compliance audits to determine weak spots within environmental compliance activities to develop improvements to increase compliance and lead to more efficient compliance systems. 
 
• Lead an extensive team effort including multiple plants, corporate resources, and legal counsel in multiple EPA Clean Air Act Section 114 requests. 
 
• Main point of contact between state and federal regulatory authorities related to environmental permitting and compliance activities for all 27 biorefineries. 
 
• Lead on-boarding training of new EH&S Specialists assigned at each biorefinery 
 
• Assist POET Research in partnership with academia on research projects to influence the development of public policy related to environmental rules and regulations.

Summary Currently a Senior Environmental Engineer with Intel Corporation holding the role of Corporate Green Building Program Manager, with 18 years of technical experience managing EHS environmental programs. As Intel Corporation's Green Building Program Manager I am responsible for ensuring the implementation of Intel's policy that all new buildings be designed to LEED NC Gold. I was the Project Manager and Program Owner for the Silver-level certification of the Intel Ocotillo Campus in Chandler, Arizona under LEED EBOM, which is the first existing building LEED certification awarded to a semiconductor manufacturing campus. Using that experience I have successfully guided other LEED EBOM projects to achieve certification, including the Intel Jerusalem wafer fabrication plant which has received LEED Platinum. I have been involved in the project teams design and construction of Intel’s newest manufacturing plants all of which which received LEED NC Gold. I successfully proposed to the USGBC the initiation of a manufacturers user group (LUGIF). The mission of the MUG is to establish a collaborative community of peers that work together to identify, share, and publicize best practices related to the design, operations and maintenance of green manufacturing facilities. The group is now in its 2nd year. I have documented alternative compliance paths for the LUGIF and provided successful credit interpretation requests or alternative compliance paths for Intel certification projects.  
 
I have managed all of the site environmental programs for a large volume high tech manufacturing campus; including chemical waste, solid waste, LEED, waste water and air program. I am leader, innovator and a sought after resources for all matters pertaining to environmental management and sustainability for Intel 
 
Specialties: Sustainability 
Compliance Management  
Chemical Waste Management  
Environmental Construction Management 
Air and Wastewater Permitting 
Decontamination
